questions.question: Find the area of the shaded region. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)

questions.question: Find angle $x$.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><circle cx="100" cy="90" r="70" fill="none" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="90" x2="30" y2="90" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="90" x2="145" y2="35" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="90" x2="145" y2="35" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="100" cy="90" r="3" fill="#EF4444"/><path d="M 85 90 A 15 15 0 0 1 92 77" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><text x="75" y="80" font-size="12" fill="#EF4444">70°</text><text x="55" y="75" font-size="12" fill="#16A34A">x</text></svg>
questions.hint: Inscribed angle is half the central angle.

questions.question: Find the area of this regular hexagon.
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="90,15 155,50 155,120 90,155 25,120 25,50" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="15" x2="90" y2="155" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="95" y="90" font-size="11" fill="#374151">10 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area $= \frac{3\sqrt{3}}{2} \times s^2$ where $s$ is the distance from center to vertex.

questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><polygon points="90,20 30,150 150,150" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="90" y1="20" x2="90" y2="100" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><line x1="90" y1="100" x2="30" y2="150" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><line x1="90" y1="100" x2="150" y2="150" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="90" y="170" text-anchor="middle" font-size="11" fill="#374151">edge = 6 cm</text></svg>

questions.question: Find the length of the median to the hypotenuse in a right triangle with legs $6$ and $8$.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="30,150 170,150 30,40" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="40" x2="100" y2="150" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><path d="M 30 130 L 50 130 L 50 150" fill="none" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="1"/><text x="95" y="165" font-size="11" fill="#374151">8</text><text x="15" y="100" font-size="11" fill="#374151">6</text><text x="65" y="90" font-size="11" fill="#EF4444">m=?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Median to hypotenuse = half the hypotenuse

questions.question: Find the volume of a frustum (truncated cone). $R=6$, $r=3$, $h=8$ ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="160" height="180" viewBox="0 0 160 180"><ellipse cx="80" cy="160" rx="55" ry="15" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><ellipse cx="80" cy="40" rx="30" ry="10" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="25" y1="160" x2="50" y2="40" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="135" y1="160" x2="110" y2="40" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><text x="140" y="105" font-size="10" fill="#374151">h=8</text><text x="110" y="165" font-size="10" fill="#374151">R=6</text><text x="90" y="35" font-size="10" fill="#374151">r=3</text></svg>

questions.question: Find the angle of elevation if a $10$ m ladder reaches $8$ m up a wall.
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="180" viewBox="0 0 180 180"><line x1="30" y1="160" x2="30" y2="40" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="30" y1="160" x2="150" y2="160" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="30" y1="60" x2="110" y2="160" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="3"/><text x="15" y="115" font-size="11" fill="#374151">8m</text><text x="65" y="100" font-size="11" fill="#16A34A">10m</text><path d="M 95 160 A 15 15 0 0 0 100 147" fill="none" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2"/><text x="100" y="150" font-size="11" fill="#EF4444">θ</text></svg>

questions.question: Find $x$. The quadrilateral is a parallelogram.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="160" viewBox="0 0 200 160"><polygon points="40,130 70,40 170,40 140,130" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="100" y="35" font-size="12" fill="#374151">3x + 5</text><text x="75" y="145" font-size="12" fill="#374151">2x + 15</text><text x="45" y="90" font-size="12" fill="#374151">y</text><text x="155" y="90" font-size="12" fill="#374151">y</text></svg>
questions.hint: Opposite sides of parallelogram are equal.

questions.question: Find the circumradius of a triangle with sides $8$, $15$, $17$.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><circle cx="100" cy="95" r="60" fill="none" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><polygon points="40,95 160,95 100,35" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="95" x2="160" y2="95" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="3,3"/><text x="95" y="165" font-size="11" fill="#374151">17</text><text x="55" y="70" font-size="11" fill="#374151">8</text><text x="135" y="70" font-size="11" fill="#374151">15</text><text x="125" y="90" font-size="11" fill="#EF4444">R=?</text></svg>

questions.question: Find the area of a circle with circumference $31.4$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: First find radius from $C = 2\pi r$, then use $A = \pi r^2$

questions.question: A right triangle has legs $9$ cm and $12$ cm. Find the altitude to the hypotenuse.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="30,150 180,150 30,30" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="150" x2="75" y2="102" stroke="#EF4444" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><path d="M 30 130 L 50 130 L 50 150" fill="none" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1"/><text x="100" y="165" font-size="11" fill="#374151">12</text><text x="15" y="95" font-size="11" fill="#374151">9</text><text x="45" y="115" font-size="11" fill="#EF4444">h=?</text></svg>
questions.hint: Area $= \frac{1}{2} \times$ base $\times$ height. Use the hypotenuse as base.

questions.question: Find the volume of a cylinder with diameter $10$ cm and height $14$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.svg: <svg width="150" height="180" viewBox="0 0 150 180"><ellipse cx="75" cy="30" rx="45" ry="12" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><ellipse cx="75" cy="150" rx="45" ry="12" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="30" y1="30" x2="30" y2="150" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="120" y1="30" x2="120" y2="150" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="125" y="95" font-size="10" fill="#374151">14 cm</text><text x="75" y="170" text-anchor="middle" font-size="10" fill="#374151">d = 10 cm</text></svg>
questions.hint: Remember: radius is half the diameter. $V = \pi r^2 h$

questions.question: Two circles have radii $5$ cm and $12$ cm. Find the distance between centers if they are externally tangent.
questions.hint: Externally tangent circles: distance = sum of radii

questions.question: Find the area of an equilateral triangle with side $8$ cm.
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="160" viewBox="0 0 180 160"><polygon points="90,20 20,140 160,140" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><text x="90" y="155" text-anchor="middle" font-size="11" fill="#374151">8 cm</text></svg>

questions.question: A cone has volume $150\pi \text{ cm}^3$ and height $18$ cm. Find the radius.
Find the length of side $x$ in this 30-60-90 triangle.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="180" viewBox="0 0 200 180"><polygon points="30,150 170,150 170,50" fill="#FEF3C7" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="2"/><path d="M 170 130 L 150 130 L 150 150" fill="none" stroke="#F59E0B" stroke-width="1"/><text x="100" y="165" font-size="11" fill="#374151">x</text><text x="175" y="105" font-size="11" fill="#374151">6</text><text x="50" y="135" font-size="11" fill="#374151">30°</text></svg>
questions.hint: In a 30-60-90 triangle, sides are in ratio $1 : \sqrt{3} : 2$

questions.question: Find the total surface area of a cube with edge $7$ cm.
questions.hint: A cube has 6 faces, each with area $s^2$

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is $20\pi$ cm. Find its area.
questions.hint: From $C = 2\pi r$, find $r$, then compute $A = \pi r^2$

questions.question: Find the hypotenuse of a right triangle with legs $7$ and $24$.
A sphere has surface area $100\pi \text{ cm}^2$. Find its radius.
Find the area of a rhombus with diagonals $10$ cm and $24$ cm.
questions.svg: <svg width="180" height="160" viewBox="0 0 180 160"><polygon points="90,10 170,80 90,150 10,80" fill="#E0E7FF" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="10" y1="80" x2="170" y2="80" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><line x1="90" y1="10" x2="90" y2="150" stroke="#4F46E5" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="130" y="75" font-size="10" fill="#374151">12</text><text x="95" y="45" font-size="10" fill="#374151">5</text></svg>

questions.question: Find the volume of a rectangular prism with dimensions $3 \times 4 \times 12$ cm.
A 45-45-90 triangle has hypotenuse $10\sqrt{2}$. Find each leg.
Find the area of a sector with radius $9$ cm and central angle $40°$. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
Find the length of a leg in a right triangle if hypotenuse $= 17$ and one leg $= 8$.
questions.hint: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2$. Solve for the unknown leg.

questions.question: A cylinder has volume $500\pi \text{ cm}^3$ and radius $5$ cm. Find the height.
Find the perimeter of a regular octagon with side $5$ cm.
Two similar triangles have a scale factor of $3:5$. If the smaller has area $27 \text{ cm}^2$, find the larger's area.
questions.hint: Area ratio equals the square of the scale factor.

questions.question: Find the volume of a cone with radius $3$ cm and slant height $5$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
An arc has length $5\pi$ cm in a circle with radius $10$ cm. Find the central angle in degrees.
Find the diagonal of a square with area $50 \text{ cm}^2$.
A pyramid has a square base with side $6$ cm and height $4$ cm. Find its volume.
Find the circumference of a circle with area $64\pi \text{ cm}^2$.
In a circle, a chord is $16$ cm long and $6$ cm from the center. Find the radius.
questions.hint: Half-chord $= 8$. Use Pythagorean theorem with distance from center.

questions.question: Find the surface area of a sphere with diameter $14$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
A trapezoid has parallel sides $8$ cm and $14$ cm, and height $5$ cm. Find its area.
questions.svg: <svg width="200" height="120" viewBox="0 0 200 120"><polygon points="50,20 150,20 180,100 20,100" fill="#DCFCE7" stroke="#16A34A" stroke-width="2"/><text x="100" y="15" text-anchor="middle" font-size="10" fill="#374151">8 cm</text><text x="100" y="115" text-anchor="middle" font-size="10" fill="#374151">14 cm</text><text x="185" y="65" font-size="10" fill="#374151">5</text></svg>

questions.question: Find the length of the apothem of a regular hexagon with side $6$ cm.
A sphere fits exactly inside a cube with edge $10$ cm. Find the sphere's volume. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: The sphere's diameter equals the cube's edge. Find radius first.

questions.question: Find the area of a triangle with vertices at $(0,0)$, $(6,0)$, and $(3,8)$.
A cone and cylinder have the same radius and height. If the cylinder's volume is $300\pi \text{ cm}^3$, find the cone's volume.
questions.hint: Cone volume is $\frac{1}{3}$ of cylinder volume with same dimensions.

questions.question: Find the exterior angle of a regular decagon.
questions.hint: Exterior angle $= \frac{360°}{n}$ where $n$ is the number of sides.

questions.question: A right triangle has one leg twice as long as the other. If the hypotenuse is $10\sqrt{5}$, find the shorter leg.
Find the volume of a triangular prism with base area $24 \text{ cm}^2$ and length $15$ cm.
An inscribed angle intercepts an arc of $140°$. What is the inscribed angle?
Find the radius of a circle inscribed in a square with side $12$ cm.
questions.hint: The inscribed circle's diameter equals the square's side.

questions.question: A cylinder has total surface area $96\pi \text{ cm}^2$ and radius $4$ cm. Find its height.
questions.hint: Total SA $= 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh$. Solve for $h$.

questions.question: Find the side length of a square with the same area as a circle with radius $5$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
Two circles with radii $8$ cm and $3$ cm are internally tangent. Find the distance between their centers.
questions.hint: For internally tangent circles: distance $=$ difference of radii

questions.question: Find the volume of a sphere whose surface area is $144\pi \text{ cm}^2$.
A 30-60-90 triangle has hypotenuse $14$. Find the longer leg.
questions.hint: In 30-60-90: short leg $= \frac{hyp}{2}$, long leg $= $ short leg $\times \sqrt{3}$

questions.question: Find the area of a regular hexagon with apothem $6\sqrt{3}$ cm.
questions.hint: From apothem, find side. Area $= \frac{1}{2} \times$ perimeter $\times$ apothem

questions.question: A cone has lateral surface area $65\pi \text{ cm}^2$ and radius $5$ cm. Find the slant height.
The ratio of the areas of two similar polygons is $16:25$. What is the ratio of their perimeters?
questions.hint: Perimeter ratio is the square root of the area ratio.

questions.question: Find the area of the shaded region between a circle and an inscribed square. Circle radius $= 5\sqrt{2}$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Square diagonal $= $ circle diameter $= 10\sqrt{2}$. Subtract square area from circle area.

questions.question: A regular polygon has interior angles of $150°$ each. How many sides does it have?
Find the height of a cylinder with volume $392\pi \text{ cm}^3$ and diameter $14$ cm.
In a right triangle, the altitude to the hypotenuse divides it into segments of $4$ and $9$. Find the altitude.
A sphere is inscribed in a cylinder. If the cylinder's height is $12$ cm, find the sphere's volume. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Sphere diameter $=$ cylinder height. So radius $= 6$.

questions.question: Find the central angle of a sector with area $12\pi \text{ cm}^2$ and radius $6$ cm.
A pyramid has a rectangular base $8 \times 6$ cm and height $10$ cm. Find its volume.
Find the length of the midsegment of a trapezoid with parallel sides $12$ cm and $20$ cm.
A cube has space diagonal $6\sqrt{3}$ cm. Find its edge length.
questions.hint: Space diagonal $= s\sqrt{3}$ where $s$ is the edge.

questions.question: Two chords intersect inside a circle. One chord is divided into segments of $3$ and $8$. The other has one segment of $4$. Find the other segment.
questions.hint: Product of segments of one chord $=$ product of segments of the other.

questions.question: Find the area of a kite with diagonals $12$ cm and $16$ cm.
questions.svg: <svg width="160" height="180" viewBox="0 0 160 180"><polygon points="80,10 140,70 80,170 20,70" fill="#FCE7F3" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="20" y1="70" x2="140" y2="70" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><line x1="80" y1="10" x2="80" y2="170" stroke="#EC4899" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/><text x="110" y="65" font-size="10" fill="#374151">6</text><text x="85" y="50" font-size="10" fill="#374151">8</text></svg>

questions.question: A semicircle has diameter $20$ cm. Find its perimeter. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
Find the volume of a hemisphere with diameter $18$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
A right triangle has hypotenuse $20$ and one leg $12$. Find the area.
questions.hint: Find the other leg first using $a^2 + 12^2 = 20^2$

questions.question: Find the number of diagonals in a regular heptagon (7-sided polygon).
A cone is inscribed in a hemisphere of radius $6$ cm. Find the cone's volume. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: The cone has the same radius and height as the hemisphere's radius.

questions.question: Find the area of a circular ring (annulus) with outer radius $10$ cm and inner radius $6$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
A regular hexagon has perimeter $36$ cm. Find its area.
Find the diagonal of a rectangle with length $15$ cm and width $8$ cm.
A cylinder has the same radius and height. If its volume is $128\pi \text{ cm}^3$, find the radius.
Find the sum of interior angles of a regular 15-sided polygon.
A sector has arc length $8\pi$ cm and radius $12$ cm. Find its area.
Find the length of a tangent from an external point $13$ cm from the center of a circle with radius $5$ cm.
questions.hint: Tangent is perpendicular to radius. Use Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: A prism has a regular hexagonal base with side $4$ cm and height $10$ cm. Find its volume.
questions.hint: First find the hexagon's area, then multiply by height.

questions.question: A circle passes through the vertices of a square with side $8$ cm. Find the circle's area. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
Find the radius of a sphere with volume $\frac{500\pi}{3} \text{ cm}^3$.
A 45-45-90 triangle has legs of length $9$. Find the area.
Find the lateral surface area of a cone with radius $8$ cm and height $15$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: First find slant height $l = \sqrt{r^2 + h^2}$, then LSA $= \pi rl$

questions.question: Two similar triangles have corresponding sides in ratio $2:3$. If the perimeter of the smaller is $30$ cm, find the larger's perimeter.
questions.hint: Perimeters are in the same ratio as corresponding sides.

questions.question: Find the area of a parallelogram with base $12$ cm and height $7$ cm.
A cone and sphere have the same radius $r$ and the cone's height equals its diameter. What is the ratio of their volumes?
questions.hint: Cone: $\frac{1}{3}\pi r^2(2r)$. Sphere: $\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3$. Simplify the ratio.

questions.question: Find the perimeter of a regular pentagon inscribed in a circle of radius $10$ cm.
A cylinder is inscribed in a sphere of radius $10$ cm. If the cylinder's height is $16$ cm, find its radius.
questions.hint: The diagonal from center to cylinder's rim edge $= 10$. Use $(h/2)^2 + r^2 = 10^2$

questions.question: Find the area of an isosceles triangle with equal sides $13$ cm and base $10$ cm.
questions.hint: Find height using Pythagorean theorem on half the base.

questions.question: A hollow sphere has outer radius $8$ cm and inner radius $6$ cm. Find the volume of the shell. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
Find the angle between a face diagonal and a space diagonal of a cube.
questions.hint: Face diagonal $= s\sqrt{2}$, space diagonal $= s\sqrt{3}$. Use dot product or trigonometry.

questions.question: A circular pizza with radius $12$ cm is cut into $8$ equal slices. Find the area of each slice. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Each slice is a sector with angle $45°$. Or divide total area by 8.

questions.question: Find the length of a median of an equilateral triangle with side $12$ cm.
A frustum of a cone has radii $4$ cm and $8$ cm, and slant height $5$ cm. Find its lateral surface area. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
A right triangle has an altitude to the hypotenuse of length $6$. If one segment of the hypotenuse is $4$, find the other segment.
Find the area of a quadrilateral with vertices at $(0,0)$, $(4,0)$, $(6,3)$, and $(2,5)$.
A sphere and cube have equal surface areas. If the sphere's radius is $6$ cm, find the cube's edge.
Find the circumference of the circle passing through all vertices of a right triangle with legs $6$ and $8$. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: The circumcircle has diameter equal to the hypotenuse.

questions.question: A cone has base circumference $12\pi$ cm and slant height $10$ cm. Find its total surface area. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: From circumference, find radius. Total SA $= \pi r^2 + \pi rl$

questions.question: Find the area of a sector with perimeter $36$ cm and radius $10$ cm.
questions.hint: Perimeter $= 2r + $ arc length. Find arc length, then area $= \frac{1}{2} \times r \times $ arc

questions.question: A regular tetrahedron has edge $8$ cm. Find its height.
Two tangent circles have radii $7$ cm and $4$ cm. Find the length of their common external tangent.
questions.hint: External tangent length $= \sqrt{d^2 - (R-r)^2}$ where $d = R + r$

questions.question: Find the volume of a regular octahedron with edge $6$ cm.
A circular segment has a central angle of $120°$ and radius $9$ cm. Find its area. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Segment area $=$ Sector area $-$ Triangle area

questions.question: Find the radius of a cone with volume $48\pi \text{ cm}^3$ and height equal to twice its radius.
A semicircle is inscribed in a rectangle with width $14$ cm. Find the rectangle's perimeter if the semicircle touches all three sides.
Find the surface area of a hemisphere with radius $5$ cm (including the flat circular base). ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
A rhombus has side $10$ cm and one diagonal $12$ cm. Find the other diagonal.
questions.hint: Diagonals bisect each other at right angles. Use Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: Find the volume of a cylinder whose curved surface area equals $264 \text{ cm}^2$ and radius $7$ cm. ($\pi \approx \frac{22}{7}$)
questions.hint: From $2\pi rh = 264$, find $h$. Then $V = \pi r^2 h$

questions.question: A circle is inscribed in an equilateral triangle with side $12$ cm. Find the circle's radius.
Find the angle between the slant height and the base of a cone with radius $5$ cm and height $12$ cm.
A square is inscribed in a semicircle of radius $10$ cm. Find the square's side length.
questions.hint: If side $= s$, the corner touches the semicircle at $(s, s/2)$. Use $x^2 + y^2 = r^2$

questions.question: Find the total surface area of a cone with radius $3$ cm and height $4$ cm. ($\pi \approx 3.14$)
questions.hint: Find slant height first. Total SA $= \pi r^2 + \pi rl$

questions.question: A chord subtends an angle of $60°$ at the center of a circle with radius $12$ cm. Find the chord's length.
questions.hint: The triangle formed is isosceles with two sides $= r$. Use the angle to find the chord.

questions.question: A cylinder has volume $1000\pi \text{ cm}^3$. If its height equals its diameter, find the radius.
Find the area of a cyclic quadrilateral with sides $4$, $5$, $7$, and $10$ and semiperimeter $13$.
A right circular cone is formed from a sector of a circle with radius $15$ cm and arc length $10\pi$ cm. Find the cone's radius.
questions.hint: The sector's radius becomes the slant height. Arc length becomes the base circumference.

questions.question: Find the length of the common chord of two circles with radii $10$ cm and $17$ cm, if the distance between centers is $21$ cm.
questions.hint: Let the chord meet the line of centers at distance $x$ from one center. Set up two Pythagorean equations.

questions.question: A sphere of radius $6$ cm is inscribed in a cone. If the cone's height is $12$ cm, find the cone's base radius.
questions.hint: The sphere touches the base and the slant surface. Use similar triangles.

questions.question: Find the radius of a circle whose area equals the sum of areas of circles with radii $3$ cm and $4$ cm.
A regular hexagonal prism has base edge $4$ cm and height $10$ cm. Find its total surface area.
